attributes.action: David Cameron to step down as prime minister, before any more damaged is caused.
attributes.additional_details:
Mr Cameron made his promise in the BBC Question Time election special 
That he would not cut child tax credits, what happened there David!
The Tories promised a cap of £72,000 for residential care, with the government paying any amount over that in an over-65 patient's lifetime.
The Conservative manifesto pledged: "We will cap charges for residential social care from April 2016.".... But wait you got elected and now they have to wait till 2020. 
And most of all you have sold the NHS !!
attributes.background: I will save the NHS he said ! I will look after the OAP's he said ! I will build thousands of homes for first time buyers he said ! I will look after the children of today he said ! Help tax credits he said !! Well David what you should of said was .. I'm David and I'm in this for what I CAN GET !

rejection.details: The resignation of the Prime Minister (or any individual Minister) is not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.
